intro: Cyclophorus taiwanensis, commonly known as the Taiwan cyclophorus, is a rare flowering plant native to Taiwan. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and distinctive, palmately lobed leaves. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
